alert.note: Alert for Clark (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 16 at 3:31PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon, including the following county, Multnomah. Portions of southwest Washington, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, especially in areas where fallen leaves are blocking drains. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to strong showers. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vancouver Downtown, Portland Downtown, Portland, Vancouver, Portland Airport, Hazel Dell South, Walnut Grove, Hazel Dell North, Five Corners, Lake Shore, Salmon Creek, Mount Vista, Orchards, St. Johns, Mill Plain, Meadow Glade, Hockinson, McLoughlin Heights and Minnehaha. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
